The electric field gradient that act on the observed nucleus affects also its resonance frequency. As such it is also a signature of the local atomic configuration. However, in the magnetic materials one is dealing with here, the electric quadrupole interaction is often much weaker than the magnetic hyperfine interaction so that the spectrum shape arises mostly from the distribution of the magnetic hyperfine field
